intro: Hieracium demissum var. pulchelliforme, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
